2.speaker: penguins
2.japanese: 南極戦隊ペンギンジャー

4.speaker: sasako
4.japanese: テレビに出るんですか
4.english: So you're going to be on TV?

6.speaker: producer
6.japanese: ぜひ ペンギンジャーさんに出演していただきたいんです
6.english: I would love for you to be on the show.

8.speaker: moms
8.japanese: 「ヤマアラシ」の番組に出るの
8.english: You're going to be on Yama Arashi's show?! Yes...

10.speaker: panda mama
10.japanese: ヤマアラシさんたちに会えるのね
10.english: You mean we'll be able to meet Yama Arashi?!

12.speaker: king
12.japanese: 早く美容室に予約入れて そうね
12.english: We have to hurry and make an appointment at the salon! You're right.

14.speaker: king
14.japanese: ネイルサロンにも予約よ

18.speaker: sasako
18.japanese: へぇ パンダ君も出るんだ
18.english: Wow, so you're going to be on it, too, Panda?

19.speaker: panda
19.japanese: うん 僕のかわいさで全国のお茶の間を騒然とさせるよ
19.english: Yeah! I'll throw living rooms across the country into a panic with my cuteness!

20.speaker: penguin
20.english: You should be helping them relax.

21.speaker: sasako
21.japanese: ペンギンさんの役は悪の皇帝でしたよね
21.english: Your role was the evil emperor, right, Mr. Penguin?

22.speaker: penguin
22.japanese: うん ダークヒーローだよ
22.english: Yeah, the dark hero. So wild.

23.speaker: sasako
23.japanese: シロクマさんも出たいんですか
23.english: Do you want to be on it, too, Mr. Polar Bear?

24.speaker: adelie
24.english: So this is a TV station! So excited!

25.speaker: panda
25.japanese: ここが 温泉に入ってごちそうを食べるだけの出演で
25.english: So this is it... The place that'll pay me just to eat and get into the hot springs.

26.speaker: handa
26.japanese: パンダ君は 黙ってて

29.speaker: forgot
29.japanese: 今日は よろしくお願いします
29.english: It's a pleasure to work with you today.

33.speaker: forgot
33.japanese: 差し入れいただきました

34.speaker: yama
34.japanese: ありがとうございます

35.speaker: panda mama
35.japanese: トラヤのヤマアラシ饅ですのよ

37.speaker: white
37.japanese: 一度 食べてみたかったんです
37.english: I've always wanted to try one.

38.speaker: both
38.japanese: ありがとうございます

39.speaker: staff
39.japanese: すみません そろそろお願いします
39.english: Pardon me, but it's about time.

40.speaker: producer
40.japanese: こちらが セットになります
40.english: This is the set. There's nothing there. I guess the TV station's hit hard times, too.

42.speaker: penguin
42.japanese: バックがＣＧ合成だからね
42.english: Well, the background is completely CG.

47.speaker: commercial
47.japanese: スッキリ シュワシュワ

48.speaker: commercial
48.japanese: いよいよ はじまるわね
48.english: Polar Bear Soda now on sale!

49.speaker: king
49.japanese: いよいよ はじまるわね

51.speaker: yama arashi
51.japanese: やまやま ヤマアラシ

53.speaker: forgot
53.japanese: さあ 次のコーナーは僕たち ヤマアラシと…
53.english: Now, for our next segment, we have us, Yama Arashi, and...

54.speaker: white
54.japanese: ふれあい動物園で大人気のペンギンジャーとの コラボ ドラマだよ
54.english: ...the petting zoo's popular South Pole Squad Penguinger!

55.speaker: voice
55.japanese: 南極戦隊ペンギンジャー

60.speaker: king
60.english: We were totally just on TV!

64.speaker: forgot
64.japanese: 何なんだ 何なんだよ
64.english: What the heck?! What's going on?

68.speaker: spikey
68.japanese: もうヤマアラシの時代は終わった
68.english: And now the era of Yama Arashi has come to an end.

69.speaker: spikey
69.english: It is now the era of traditional entertainment, comedic storytelling!

70.speaker: penguin
70.japanese: ええ 毎度バカバカしいお噺を一席

71.speaker: penguin
71.japanese: おい どんどん お酌してやれ
71.english: Hey, pour him another cup. What is this?

73.speaker: announcer
73.japanese: ＜悪の皇帝は全世界の電波をジャックして

74.speaker: penguin
74.japanese: ＜悪の皇帝は全世界の電波をジャックして
74.english: {\a6}Something good will happen at the tenement house very soon. hijacked the world's airwaves

75.speaker: announcer
75.english: and broadcasted "The Flower Viewing From the Tenement House."

79.speaker: panda
79.japanese: あっ 次は僕のシーンだよ

80.speaker: gentoo
80.japanese: おやっさん コーヒーおかわり
80.english: Could I get another coffee, Pops?

82.speaker: chin
82.japanese: おやっさん カレーアイス 大盛りで４杯
82.english: Pops, could I get four large servings of curry ice cream? Our large servings are the real deal.

83.speaker: polar bear
83.english: Better make it two. I want my usual!

84.speaker: polar bear
84.english: A large serving of bamboo grass, right?

87.speaker: panda
87.japanese: ここだけで瞬間最高視聴率４０パーセントだね
87.english: They reached an instantaneous max viewership of forty percent right there.

88.speaker: sasako
88.japanese: パンダ君のシーンって 今の
88.english: Was that your whole scene, Panda?

90.speaker: announcer
90.japanese: ここが秘密基地 ペンギンジャールームだ
90.english: This is their secret base:The Penguinger Room.

91.speaker: voice
91.japanese: 悪の皇帝が ヤマアラシを誘拐した
91.english: The Evil Emperor kidnapped Yama Arashi. Your mission is to safely rescue Yama Arashi

92.speaker: voice
92.japanese: 皇帝軍団を倒すこと 以上
92.english: and defeat the Emperor army. That is all.

96.speaker: adelie
96.japanese: ペンギンジャー ジェット

98.speaker: forgot
98.japanese: クソッ どうするつもりだ
98.english: Dang it! What are you planning to do with us?! Let us go!

101.speaker: penguin
101.japanese: お前たちを落語しか聞けない体に改造してやる
101.english: I'm going to turn your bodies into ones that can only listen to comedic storytelling.

111.speaker: gentoo
111.japanese: ジェンツーフリッパー

115.speaker: forgot
115.japanese: ありがとう キミたち

119.speaker: penguin
119.japanese: クソ ペンギンジャーめ

120.speaker: adelie
120.japanese: 南極の支配者 悪の皇帝
120.english: The ruler of the South Pole, the Evil Emperor!

121.speaker: gentoo
121.japanese: なぜ こんなことを

124.speaker: penguin
124.japanese: 私は人気者が大嫌いなんだよ
124.english: I hate those who are popular!

125.speaker: chin
125.japanese: 憎しみからは何も生まれないぞ

126.speaker: penguin
126.japanese: 私の落語がつまらないとバカにした世界に
126.english: I'm going to take revenge on the world

127.japanese: リベンジしてやるんだ
127.english: that called my comedic storytelling boring!

130.speaker: porcupines
130.japanese: 頑張れ ペンギンジャー

132.speaker: adelie
132.japanese: みんな… もう あれしかない
132.english: You guys... We have no other choice!

134.speaker: adelie
134.japanese: いくぞ ペンギンジャーストーム

137.speaker: chin
137.japanese: いくぞ ジェンツー

139.speaker: forgot
139.english: It turned into a fish dumpling! Fish!

142.speaker: penguin
142.japanese: 今日のところは勘弁してやる 覚えてろよ
142.english: I'll let you live today. You'll pay for this!

143.speaker: penguin
143.japanese: パピプペポー ペンペンギーン
143.english: Pa pi pu pe po! Pen penguin! Thank you, Penguingers!

144.speaker: one
144.japanese: また何かあったらいつでも助けにきます
144.english: If something happens again... ...we'll come to your aid anytime.

146.speaker: all
146.japanese: 南極戦隊 ペンギンジャー

147.speaker: announcer
147.japanese: こうして地球に再び平和が訪れた
147.english: And so peace was restored to the Earth again.

148.speaker: announcer
148.japanese: キミたちは 真の勇者だ

149.speaker: announcer
149.japanese: ありがとう ペンギンジャー ペンギンジャー

150.speaker: panda
150.japanese: 僕って やっぱりかわいいね

151.speaker: tv
151.japanese: 僕って やっぱりかわいいね
151.english: {\a6}And now, please listen to our song: Yama Arashi Tonight!

152.speaker: penguin
152.japanese: キミのシーン 必要だったかな

155.speaker: adelie
155.japanese: イワトビさん ラストの死にっぷりすごくよかったですよ
155.english: Mr. Rockhopper, your death scene at the end was fantastic!

156.speaker: spikey
156.japanese: いやいや あなたたちもかっこよかったですよ
156.english: Nah. You guys were super cool, too.

157.speaker: spikey
157.english: Thanks for all your hard work!

159.speaker: polar bear
159.japanese: アドリブでダジャレ結構 挟んだんだけど
159.english: I had ad-libbed a whole bunch of puns,

160.speaker: polar bear
160.japanese: なんでカットされたんだろ
160.english: I wonder why they were cut.

161.speaker: penguins
161.japanese: 南極戦隊 ペンギンジャー

162.speaker: handa
162.japanese: あれ以来 更に大人気だな
162.english: They're even more popular since the broadcast.

163.speaker: kirino
163.japanese: ペンギンカードの売り上げも倍増ですって
163.english: The penguin cards sales have exploded, too.

166.speaker: guy
166.english: It seems to be a DVD. Who's it from?

169.speaker: guy
169.japanese: ペンギンジャーのスピンアウトですかね
169.english: I wonder if it's a spin-off of Penguinger?

173.speaker: llama
173.japanese: 草食しぇんたい ラマレンジャー

174.speaker: llama
174.japanese: しょうしょく戦隊… 草食戦隊 ハマレンジャー

177.speaker: llama
177.english: {\a6}Herbivore Hentai! Let's pretend we never saw this...

178.speaker: masaki
178.japanese: まだまだ培煎って ナンダ

184.speaker: masaki
184.japanese: それ バイソンだし

185.speaker: polar bear
185.japanese: 「マ マ マ マハロ」

186.speaker: masaki
186.japanese: 焙煎っすよ ば い せ ん

187.speaker: sasako
187.japanese: まだ焙煎させてもらえないの
187.english: Are you still not allowed to roast?

188.speaker: masaki
188.japanese: いらないクズ豆を使った練習はやってるんすけど
188.english: I've been able to practice with beans that we don't need...

189.speaker: masaki
189.japanese: 本格的なのは まだ一度も
189.english: But I haven't done it for real even once.

190.speaker: masaki
190.japanese: きっと師匠から見たら 俺がまだまだってことなんすよ
190.english: Which probably means that in Master's eyes, I still have a ways to go.

191.speaker: panda
191.japanese: マサキ君って マジメにしてても チャラチャラして見えるもんね
191.english: Well, even when you're serious,you look all flashy. You have such a cute face but a sharp tongue, Panda!

192.speaker: panda
192.japanese: かわいいのは わかってるよ

193.speaker: penguin
193.japanese: キミの耳って都合の悪い情報をカットする
193.english: Your ears have a noise-canceling function

194.speaker: penguin
194.japanese: ノイズキャンセリング付きだよね
194.english: that blocks out anything inconvenient to you, don't they?

195.speaker: polar bear
195.japanese: マサキ君 これ食べてみて

197.speaker: masaki
197.japanese: ジャリジャリした歯ざわりっすね

198.speaker: masaki
198.japanese: でも 豆を噛んだときにコーヒーの香りが広がって
198.english: But when I bite into them, the aroma of coffee fills my mouth

199.speaker: masaki
199.japanese: 香味がよくわかるっす
199.english: and I can really taste the flavor.

201.speaker: masaki
201.japanese: 苦くて酸っぱいけど 意外においしいっす
201.english: It's a bit bitter and sour, but it's rather delicious.

202.speaker: polar bear
202.japanese: 上手に焙煎された コーヒー豆は
202.english: Coffee beans that have been roasted properly

203.speaker: polar bear
203.japanese: そのまま食べてもおいしいんだよね
203.english: taste good even if you eat them.

204.speaker: polar bear
204.japanese: キノボリカンガルーさんの豆みたいにね

205.speaker: masaki
205.japanese: 俺もいつか こんなおいしい豆を焙煎してみたいっす
205.english: I want to be able to roast delicious beans like this someday.

206.speaker: sasako
206.japanese: 早く焙煎できるといいね
206.english: Hopefully you'll be able to roast properly soon.

208.speaker: puppet
208.japanese: 笹子さん はじめまして
208.english: Nice to meet you, Miss Sasako.

212.speaker: puppet
212.japanese: 居酒屋で意気投合した キンシコウの師匠に弟子入りして修業を…
212.english: I'm currently apprenticing under Master Golden Snub-nosed Monkey who I hit it off with at an izakaya... So I started...

214.speaker: RS
214.japanese: 豆を焼く手つきがさまになってきたわね
214.english: Your roasting technique is getting much better.

215.speaker: masaki
215.japanese: 今日は クズ豆じゃないし
215.english: Today I'm not using reject beans

216.speaker: masaki
216.japanese: みんなに 特製のマサキコーヒーをごちそうするっす
216.english: so I'm going to treat everyone to some special Masaki coffee.

219.speaker: RS
219.japanese: マサキ もしかして上達したんじゃない
219.english: It looks like you may have improved, Masaki.

221.speaker: mama rs
221.japanese: でも私 もっとまったりとした味のが飲みたいわ
221.english: But I still want to drink something a bit more rich.

223.speaker: mama rs
223.japanese: マサキのコーヒーは苦みはあるけど コクが足りない気がするのよね
223.english: Masaki's coffee has bitterness, but I think it's lacking richness.

225.speaker: masaki
225.japanese: ゆっくり いれれば濃くなるはずじゃないのか
225.english: If I pour it slower, shouldn't it be richer?

226.speaker: kangaroo
226.japanese: しろくまカフェに配達あるんだけど
226.english: I have a delivery for Polar Bear's Café.

227.speaker: masaki
227.japanese: あっ はい 行きます

228.speaker: rs
228.japanese: 厳しいわね エゾリスママ
228.english: You're so harsh, Mama Red Squirrel.

229.speaker: rs
229.japanese: マサキ コーヒーの味 上達したじゃない
229.english: Masaki's coffee tastes much better than before.

230.speaker: rs
230.japanese: 仕事も真面目にしてるし

231.speaker: rs
231.japanese: ハンドピックだって ずいぶん手際よくなったわよね
231.english: He's also gotten much better at hand picking.

233.speaker: masaki
233.japanese: シロクマさん コーヒーのコクって何すか
233.english: Mr. Polar Bear! What's the richness of coffee?

235.speaker: masaki
235.japanese: エゾリスママにコクがないって言われたっす
235.english: Mama Red Squirrel said I'm lacking richness.

236.speaker: panda
236.english: Yeah. Your face is lacking richness, Masaki. Such a venomous tongue.

238.speaker: sasako
238.japanese: ペンギンさん やめませんか

239.speaker: polar bear
239.japanese: コーヒーは どうやって いれてる
239.english: How are you pouring the coffee?

240.speaker: masaki
240.japanese: ペーパードリップです

241.speaker: polar bear
241.japanese: だったら コクの少ないスッキリした味にしかならないね
241.english: Then it'll end up having a light flavor without much richness.

243.speaker: polar bear
243.japanese: コーヒーの味は器具によって変わるんだ
243.english: The flavor of coffee changes depending on the equipment you use.

245.speaker: polar bear
245.japanese: 試しに 同じ豆で飲み比べてみようか
245.english: To test things out, let's compare different preparation methods with the same beans.

247.speaker: masaki
247.japanese: ペーパーより まろやかな味だ
247.english: It's a milder taste than a paper drip.

248.speaker: polar bear
248.japanese: 次は コーヒープレス

249.speaker: masaki
249.japanese: いちばんコクがあるっす

250.speaker: masaki
250.japanese: 味って こんなに変わるんだ
250.english: I didn't know the taste could change so much...

251.speaker: polar bear
251.japanese: コクを左右するのは 豆の油
251.english: It's the oil of the beans that determines the richness.

252.speaker: polar bear
252.japanese: 油分の濃さの違いなんだよ
252.english: The more oil, the richer it becomes.

253.speaker: masaki
253.japanese: いれる器具も大切ってことか
253.english: So I guess the equipment used is important, too.

255.speaker: mama rs
255.japanese: ねぇ マサキのことなんだけど…

256.speaker: mama rs
256.japanese: そろそろ いいんじゃないの

257.speaker: rs
257.english: It's been over six months, hasn't it?

258.speaker: rs
258.japanese: マサキだって真面目に働いてるし

259.speaker: mama rs
259.japanese: マサキに焙煎やらせてあげましょうよ
259.english: Let's allow Masaki to do some roasting.

260.speaker: kangaroo
260.japanese: なんで エゾリスたちが言うんだな
260.english: Why are you red squirrels bringing this up?

261.speaker: kangaroo
261.japanese: そのつもりだったんだな

262.speaker: kangaroo
262.japanese: 実は 明日から焙煎を手伝ってもらうつもりだったんだな
262.english: I was actually going to have him start helping me roast tomorrow.

266.speaker: masaki
266.japanese: 師匠 ホントっすか

268.speaker: kangaroo
268.japanese: マサキに キノボリコーヒーの味を
268.english: I want you to be able to roast Tree Kangaroo coffee.

269.speaker: masaki
269.japanese: 師匠の味を俺も作れるようになる
269.english: I'll be able to roast the same flavor as Master! I... I'll do my best! Congratulations, Masaki.

270.speaker: masaki
270.english: I, Masaki, am training to be a master coffee roaster.

271.speaker: penguin
271.english: I'm Penguin. I'm training to become...

273.speaker: sasako
273.japanese: ペンギンさん それ いつまで続くんですか
273.english: Mr. Penguin, how long are you going to do that?

276.speaker: Panda
276.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

278.speaker: panda
278.japanese: どうして生乾きの洗濯物の匂いの入浴剤は発売されないのかな
278.english: I wonder why they don't release a laundry detergent that smells like wet laundry.

279.speaker: penguin
279.japanese: たぶん 臭いなって思うからじあないかな
279.english: Probably because they think it stinks.

280.speaker: sasako
280.japanese: 最近はそんなのあるんですね
280.english: So they have something like that now?

281.speaker: penguin
281.japanese: ないよ 自分がしゃべてない時も集中
281.english: No, they don't. You need to be concentrating when you're not talking, too.

282.speaker: penguin
282.japanese: シロクマ君 終わて

283.speaker: polar bear
283.japanese: 来週のシロクマカフェイは
283.english: Please watch next week's Polar Bear's Café

284.speaker: polar bear
284.japanese: テレビから50メートル離れてご覧ください
284.english: from fifty meters away from your TV. I don't think even Mr. Sankhon could see that.
